summary: Email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial regarding stipulations to the authenticity of depositions and other documents. The emails discuss procedural matters and preparations for trial, including proposed verdict forms and scheduling.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell corresponding with prosecutors about stipulating to the authenticity of depositions and other documents.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial stipulations.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial stipulations.

persons.name: Bobbi C Sternheim
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell copied on email correspondence regarding trial stipulations.

persons.name: Lara E. Pomerantz
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York involved in the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution, sending proposed verdict forms and stipulations.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, mentioned as someone the prosecution plans to raise issues with regarding document authentication.

connections.description: Prosecutor and defense attorney corresponding about trial stipulations and procedural matters in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Email exchange about trial stipulations
events.description: Prosecution sends corrected stipulations to defense regarding authenticity of depositions and discusses need for decisions on birth certificates and statements.

events.title: Defense agrees to stipulate to depositions
events.description: Defense attorney Christian Everdell informs prosecution they are prepared to stipulate to authenticity of three depositions (CA, DA, GM) but need more time for other documents.

events.title: Prosecution sends second set of proposed stipulations
events.description: Prosecution sends additional proposed stipulations to defense and requests response before Wednesday's conference.

events.title: Initial submission of verdict form and stipulations
events.description: Prosecution sends draft verdict form and four proposed stipulations to defense, requesting return by November 5.

keyFacts: The defense agreed to stipulate to the authenticity of three depositions (referenced as CA, DA, and GM) but needed more time to consider stipulating to birth certificates and a statement.
The prosecution planned to raise the authentication issue with Judge Nathan on Monday (November 15, 2021) to seek a briefing schedule if necessary.
The correspondence shows ongoing trial preparation activities including proposed verdict forms and stipulations about document authenticity.
The emails reference the need to prepare records custodians if stipulations aren't agreed upon, indicating these documents would require witness testimony for authentication.
